name: HTML Elements
description: HyperText Markup Language, is the standard markup language used to create web pages

Document Metadata.val: Provides metadata about the document, including its title, scripts and style sheets
Specifies a link to an external resource, typically style sheets
Any metadata information that cannot be represented by one of the other HTML meta-related elements (<base>, <link>, <script>, <style> or <title>)
Contains style information for a document written in CSS
Defines the title of the document, shown in a browser's title bar or on the page's tab

Content Sectioning.val: Represents the content of a document. There can only be one <body> element in a document
Represents a footer typically containing copyright data or links to related documents
Represents a group of elements like a logo, a search form, and navigation bar
A heading element briefly describes the topic of the section it introduces. <h1> is the most important and <h6> is the least
Represents a section of a page that links to other pages or to parts within the page

Text Content.val: A generic container for flow content. It can be used to group elements for styling purposes (using the class or id attributes)
Represents a thematic break between paragraphs, defined in semantic rather than presentational terms
Represents an item in a list and must be contained in a parent element: an ordered list (<ol>), an unordered list (<ul>), or a menu (<menu>)
Represents an ordered list of items, typically displayed with a sequencial numbering
Represents preformatted text (i.e. text that is displayed without text formatting)
Represents an unordered list of items, typically displayed with a bullet
Defines the contact information for the author/owner of a document or an article

Inline Text Semantics.val: Defines a hyperlink to a location on the same page or any other page on the Web
Represents a span of text whose typical presentation would be boldfaced
Produces a line break in text (carriage-return)
Represents a fragment of computer code and displayed in the browser's default monospace font
Marks text that has stress emphasis. The <em> element can be nested, with each level of nesting indicating a greater degree of emphasis
Represents a range of text that is typically displayed in italic type
Renders text with a strikethrough, or a line through it
A generic inline container for phrasing content It can be used to group elements for styling purposes (using the class or id attributes)
Gives text strong importance, and is typically displayed in bold
Renders text with an underline, a line under the baseline of its content

Images and Multimedia.val: Defines a hot-spot region on an image, and optionally associates it with a hypertext link. This element is used only within a <map> element
Used to embed sound content in documents
The HTML Image Element () represents an image of the document
Used with <area> elements to define an image map (a clickable link area)
Used as a child of <audio> and <video> elements. It lets you specify timed text tracks such as subtitles
The HTML <video> element is used to embed video content

Table Content.val: Represents the title of a table
Defines a cell of a table that contains data
Defines a cell that is a header for a group of cells of a table
Defines a row of cells in a table. Those can be a mix of <td> and <th> elements

Forms.val: Contains a set of <option> elements that represent the values available for other controls
Used to group several controls as well as labels (<label>) within a web form
Represents the parent element of a web form in a document section
Used to create interactive controls to accept data from the user
Represents a caption for an item in a user interface. A control element can be placed inside a <label> element, or by using the for attribute
Represents a caption for the content of its parent <fieldset>
Creates a grouping of options within a <select> element
Used to create a control representing an item within a <select>, an <optgroup> or a <datalist> element
Represents the result of a calculation or user action
Represents a control that presents a menu of options. The options within the menu are represented by <option> elements, which can be grouped by <optgroup> elements
Represents a multi-line plain text editing control

Embedded Content.val: Represents an integration point for an external application or interactive content
Represents a nested browsing context, effectively embedding another HTML page into the current page
Represents an external resource, which can be treated as an image, a nested browsing context, or a resource to be handled by a plugin
An empty element used to specify multiple media resources for <picture>, <audio> and <video> elements

Scripting.val: Used to draw graphics, photo compositions or animations via scripting, typically written in JavaScript
Defines a section of HTML to be inserted if a script type on the page is unsupported or if scripting is currently turned off in the browser
Used to embed or reference an executable script, typically written in JavaScript
